items.message: River levels remain high as a result of the recent rainfall but have been  continuing to fall slowly at the Brokenborough river gauge. Some further rainfall is forecast later this afternoon and evening, 28/05/2021,  so there is still a flood risk and possibility of flooding for the road at Reybridge.   Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland remains possible until later tomorrow, 29/05/2021.  We continue to closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 10:00 on Saturday, 29/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels are currently falling on the River Thame and have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. This evening and overnight is forecast to be mainly dry.
We continue to monitor the situation. Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.72mAOD at 04:45 on 28/05/21 and 4.65mAOD at 17:00 on 28/05/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 111 cubic metres per second and is falling slowly. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 28/05/21, or as the situation changes.

This flood alert has been removed. 
The next three high tides are not forecast to reach levels where the river will overtop the banks.  
We continue to monitor the situation.
